content.raw:
Honestly, I don’t remember what exactly I was thinking here. Maybe I thought that planes could only be pointed upwards or downwards, so this would have to be either a \+1 or -1. But that’s not a useful representation of a plane.

I agree with you that a plane in 2D should be thought of as a line with a normal vector where the normal vector indicates which half of the x/y plane is free space and which half is collision space. The API here will need to be changed.

Honestly, I don’t remember what exactly I was thinking here. Maybe I thought that planes could only be pointed upwards or downwards, so this would have to be either a +1 or -1. But that’s not a useful representation of a plane.

I agree with you that a plane in 2D should be thought of as a line with a normal vector where the normal vector indicates which half of the x/y plane is free space and which half is collision space. The API here will need to be changed.
